Who's your Square? Take the quiz
More than great...I don't know if this is a good thing thou...
It's pretty easy...when you have 750 NES games... Try it for yourself! http://www.destructoid.com/?p=1233

SAT>9:30 call at work to edit---EMERGENCY---I get rushed up stairs for urgent stage fixes for a Pilot.  umm...of course I can do it.  Got the hang of the room after a while.  Hero to many. - Drove to San Pedro for a loverlee concert...ran into Nick Miller...why was Nick Miller is San Pedro...no one will ever know (I really do know, Nick...but I'm trying to make it more dramatic).  Played loverlee show...twas fun...I twas tired...twas hard to remember how to play songs.

SUN>8:30 to finish what I was really supposed to be cutting on SAT, along with the days work...14 hours later I go home

MON>8:00 to finish what I didn't finish SUN...then back to the vault...the to YM&I concert-I think tonight at least.

There once was this boy.  Who decided to fill in his calendar while he was a wee bit tipsy.  Fill it in with important dates and appointments and other plans.  This brings us to the month of May...or as the Spanish call it "Mayo".  It was in this fateful month that the story of the erroneous error occurred...dun dun dun!!  Knowing he was playing a concert on Cinco De Mayo, he quickly filled in the date on his calendar (May 4th - Show at the Derby).  I sick feeling rushed over him as he rushed to open up the envelope in which sat his tickets to the Daniel Johnston concert.  May 4th.  The date.  The date that sounded really really familiar!  Too familiar!  That was the date of the concert he was playing at the Derby!  Nooooooo!  After some smart thinking, he figured out how he could play the concert at the Derby, and then rush straight on after to Spaceland for Daniel Johnston.  The tension of the whole situation still gnawed at him, tormenting his dreams.

Flash forward to Tuesday night...while attending unsaid concert...He told a friend about the Daniel Johnston concert.  "What date might this revelry of music fall upon?"  He immediately replied "May 4th, Cinco De Mayo."  Then it hit him...after 3 years of failing to learn Spanish...it hit him hard!  THE END

Do my eyes deceive me!  I was doing my daily Amazon deal search, and stumbled upon the Super Mario Bros. Super Show DVD!  Just released today!  This is very exciting...I'm hoping that it gets favorable reviews, so I can add it to my ridiculous DVD collection.  Definitely worthy of a LJ post.

"Swing your arms from side to side, come on, it's time, lets go, do the Mario!"

The Euelogy:

You have brought joy to many.  Thoughtful, fun, exciting, adventurous, political, and religious...MMH had a place in many of our hearts.  From the Eagles to Ducktales, MMH encompassed so much love, and shared it with many.  Many bored, work-ridden souls enjoyed the loving prose of MMH and took comfort in its words.  The RECA community will need to find another sanctuary to congregate and leave hundreds of messages.

Non-More-Indie
Farewell, MMH

You know, make it through Checkpoint Charlie by the skin of my teeth."

There has been little to do at work, and lots to do at home.  I guess that is why I spend 9 hours at work and less than 5 non-sleeping hours at home...So many electronic drumsbeat to play...So many Nintendo games to organize...So many takes to finally get a good slide guitar solo on the Loverlee demos.

I had the best lunch ever today///Soy Pepper Steak & Flat Noodle/Vege. medley ...yummy yum yum!!
Not to forget the Jelly Belly / Pixie Sticks desert...

Why must I
Pickle pie
Why must I
Why must I
To seek the empire of forbidden senses
To quary to rocks of daring suspense's
Why must I
And why must Batman fight Dracula in a cartoon extravaganza
Tony Danza
Beau Banana

So many things accomplished this week.  Composed an awesome song on Mario Paint...and decided I'm gonna do a whole CD of Mario Paint songs/composing with the RutherCrew.  AND..Not only did Chris, Anthony & I beat Donkey Kong Country...but finished Super Mario World in the same day...why?...because we can.  Much further beyond this...on a whim, and because he looks like one of the Moles from SMW...weS located the Justin Fields number and I called him for fun...it was funny...more than you can imagine.

Got a new car stereo so I can finally play burnt CDs, mp3 CDs, and plug in a flash drive and play off that...The EQ is great for a car stereo...smooth 100Hz / 10KHz shelfs...no muddy sound...happy Jason.

Also, got some more recording done for the Loverlee songs.  They are sounding really good!!  Will have some posted in a couple of days.

Now I'm sitting here...eatting Gummy Bears...writing this...why?...because I can.

Hundreds of deer are flocking to the mountains to curate what appears to be a giant wooly Mammoth made of pine, cedar, and merry-go-round horse wood.  With such a wooly mammoth, these Deer can persuade the leaders of many great nations to turn over all of their chocolate.  What would happen if the world was to suffer a holiday season without chocolate?

The Facts:

1) Fondue will not be as fun

2)  Jews resorting to using real money instead of foil-covered chocolate substitutes, when gambling with dradel.

3)  No chocolate covered pretzles shaped like Jesus on the cross.

4)  The Easter Bunny will need to start planning for an alternative Easter...and be too busy to ponder the real meaning of Christmas (which he does annually)

5)  B-Horror movies will resort to using ketchup instead of Hershey syrup

6)  People will probably die (thou dog will not have to live in fear)

7)  Rats will take over the human race and Sir Raticlease will rule (of course humans will be slaves, and only be able to be saved by Jesus the Rat...dawning a new era of Human/Rat approbation)

8)  Santa will lose the will to deliever presents (probably start a rice farm somewhere-it will fail-he will then lose the will to live)

9)  A Tarantula name Louise va Derolise will become the president of New America-4 and use giant robots to destroy invading creatures from the heavens.

10)  Gremlins 3 - the Musical, will be the most watched movie on TV, being aired 24-7 thru the month of December

AMEN
Yey for Snow & My Birthday & Vegetarian Thanksgivings  (10 year anniversary)!!  Snowy snow snow snow...

...very, very hungry... I couldn't fall asleep last night...I needed to eat...I had dinner...I don't know. I just hungry. Pretty crazy weekend... ...movie premiere (one of those sad uplifting movies)->followed by<- DAME FORTUNE concert!! I recommend the Red Rover music video. Totally great... I decided I want to start composing music again. I wish I was better at keyboard thou. It makes things much easier. New Loverlee songs is great. It is about a Dog that steals your shoe...just one shoe mind you, so you have the chase the dog...who is completely wasting your time... --- ...this is my interpretation of the song at least. Target sales are the best...ottomans, rugs, and pillows....weeeeee! And a cool skull & crossbones belt (meant for kids)...I think Wes might have the same one...we are twins...weeeee!

Slept in a stable, next to horses, in Santa Barbara.  Friend Steven lives there...small 12'x12' room, with a small bathroom separating him from the horse next door.  I think the horse's name is Tucker.  Not a band roommate, thou he kicks the wall sometimes, and rattles the whole sheet metal barn.  After a good nights sleep, it was wine tasting time!  Yey!  Also found a place with beer tasting and fancy cheeses.  Ummmm...Cheeses.  Like I said...very classy.  It put me in the camping mood.  I must go camping.  Somewhere.  Like Japan.

I spent last night writing a song with serious lyrics...yeah...I know.  Much harder than writing about animals.  Usually my serious songs end up really really lame.  This one I'm a bit more comfortable with...less forced/contrived.  No chorus, because there is no place in serious songs for chorus.

I don't think I'll be able to eat this whole bowl of pea-soup/

Yummy!!

So alright...2 projects that just came in and brought a smile to my face... Tesla : The Lost Wizard amazing...this Tesla "revival"...I don't know how many times in the past couple of weeks that I've heard Tesla's name come up. Minotaur what more can I say. We got in something called Minotaur!! One of the best mythological beasts ever! I'd say on par with the Manticore. Currently, The Minotaur Song is in production, on it's way to Mr. Snail's Halloween Party. It shall be magical. Trader Joes FINALLY got in more Vegetarian Tofu Pad Thai...FINALLY!! And other than spending my money on Trader Joe's Vegetarian Tofu Pad Thai, I've continue my pursuit of immense Nintendo Game collecting. It's hard not to buy something when it is so darn cheap. Bulk is Bad... I had the worst wine last night... Lesson Learned: Just because C.S. is only $2 at TJ's, doesn't mean that $1.25 TJ wine will be any good. It tastes as if someone added Manishevitz to Charles Shaw...maybe some grape kool-aid too...ooooo yeah!! Eeeuuugggg If I won the lotto I'd be so happy. Which is sad...Why do I need money. Why can't I just do things... Why do I need money... If I wanted to buy cheese...I mean...you can't just get cheese...you have to buy a cow...or find a cow I guess...which might be like winning the lotto for a farmer...but you have to buy cheese. And why is cheese funny?! Where can the origins of humorous cheese be found. From "Cutting the Cheese" to "Got any cheeeeeeese?"...cheese is funny. I guess it is just a fact. And I take solace in that.

once again,,,another inspirational band name I love... Orange Spice tea with Honey is the best...and I love it... I feel really busy, and really bored at the same time. I have plenty to do, but really nothing to do. I played Skate or Die for a little while (worst play control ever)...after watching Danger Mouse. Having recently reviewed Jurassic Park, I realized that CG hasn't gotten any better...people just got better at blending it into real environments (Star Wars is the only rebut against this). At least they used animatronics when they needed to...! ...blah...I can't do this right now...so I will do this:
...MANTICORE!!

Together and part they are magical things.

It wasn't enough just to play the Karate Kid game on my NES...I needed to watch the movies again...

It's been about 10 years, if not longer (possibly 2nd grade), since I've seen the Karate Kid.

So, good ol' amazon had the trilogy (+ evil "the next karate kid") for $27...

Just finished the trilogy last night.  I really enjoyed pt. 2 ---the first was a bit slow, and pt. 3 was a bit ridiculous.

Regardless, Ninja Turtles trilogy is on it's way...

So...back to nintendo...

I'm now the proud owner of my 5th NES...
Was at the Goodwill, found a copy of Captain N (the nintendo master) cartoon in the VHS area...and while prusing the shelves for a corkscrew, discovered a NES...got the whole lot for $8.  what a steal.  it was a very nintendo day.

Probably gonna start refurbishing them, and selling them to feed my evergoing NES game addiction.  I must have them all.  Not just them all...but 3 of each...for VIDEO ARMAGGEDON.  

--Mega Man 2 dual took place and was awesome--

Well...my new found goal is very close to being reached.

Tally and Qualification:

NES #1 = YES
NES #2 = YES
NES #3 = NO

TV #1 = YES
TV #2 = YES
TV #3 = NO

Super Mario Bros. 3 #1 = YES
Super Mario Bros. 3 #2 = YES
Super Mario Bros. 3 #3 = YES

A reenactment of "Video Armageddon" WILL take place.  I'd prefer to be Lucas.  "The Power Glove...it's so bad"

...still trying to get 50,000 on Double Dragon thou...


New band is going really good...it is really fun...and I really want to play a RBHID show soon...hmmmm

01. Think of the first word that comes to mind when you think of me.
02. Run a Google image search on that word.
03. Reply to this entry and post one of the pictures from your search, but don't tell me what the word was.
04. Put this in your journal, so I can do the same
I made a Quiz for you! Take my Quiz! and then Check out the Scoreboard! Please do it'...'I'm really bored
I made a Quiz for you! Take my Quiz! and then Check out the Scoreboard! [i left in all the cheesey text in the default link] ...so lame...

you are nona f. mecklenberg. you're bubbly and
loopy. you're very superstitious and weird. you
wear a cast on your (unbroken) left arm because
you like the constant itch. psychological
underpinnings? perhaps. you most likely have a
bright career as an art teacher or modern dance
instructor ahead of you.

You're the incandescent nona F. Mecklenberg. Go
you! I can't believe Iggy Pop is your dad!

Your Mr. Mecklenberg!..er just iggy pop.. and in
the show you have a daughter that wears a cast
on her arm in every episode she appears in. (close enough...Nona wasn't an Option I Guess) What can I say...best show on TV ever... I think after watching this show, you will understand me much better...if in fact, you are a bit confused. I am.

Funniest unintentional movie moment ever...

I can't even rant about how bad Star Wars was...I think what made it so bad is it had lots of potential...if a few things were cut (really bad dialog [is there no other way to show a loving relationship other than to blatantly talk about how strong your love is])...ridiculous amount of ridiculous transitions...Jar Jar...and things should be added such as more Chewbacca, more interesting story with some unexpected twists (when you already know what is gonna happen, why not stir it up a bit), and maybe some good acting (only Lucas can make good actors suck)...Lucas sucks hard.

I must say, I could not help laughing thru a lot of the movie...A+ commedy..."Noooooooooo"....wow

So right before the movie there was this awesome 8-Bit Video Game inspired Art exhibit i went to in Hollywood... www.iam8bit.net  ...  great art and open bar  ...  strangely enough served by Suicide Girls.
Nerds + Suicide Girls = very awkward.

So that whole thing was very awesome...

"Noooooooooo"

So...mega awesomeness...I think at least...

I, as of very soon, will be a union boy = big raise...and some other shit.

Not the most indie...but hell...I'll sell out.

I, as of recently, am really into surf music.  I did this one surf song for songfight, and it got a great response.  Listen if you will:

http://www.songfight.org/music/scissor_kick/deadrutherford_sk.mp3

Just finished the Back To The Future trilogy.  It's been at least 10 years since I've seen Part II, and for good reason...it was incredibly awful (almost as bad as the video game)...other then filling in some story, there is no reason to watch it. I & III are awesome thou.

(this part is just for Mark)
With as little explanation is possible, our shows have short name folders for our server...

so for the show "Night Stalker" we get...

Nigsta

EDIT:  and Mike...your lack of proliferation is appalling

Wow...hit a brick wall of boredom after 2 hellish weeks of pilot season.

But back to the weekend.  Cinema Sports was most amazingly fun.  The film we (RBHID crew + 2) made was much more than I ever expected.  It was a 80's Film Noir parody...nuff said.  It will be posted on the internet soon.  We got a great response from the view audience, lots of big laughter and praise.  I guess I should have prefaced this:

We had 9 hours to make a film from start to end, including 4 "ingredients":
1) A conversation about the spirit world
2) Someone steps on something by accident
3) A close-up of a street sign
4) A secret is revealed

We just made it under time, but due to Cher...we were stuck in mucho traffico, hence making us a bit late...but nothing devastating.

On the otherside...I did something really dumb and hypocritical...
I bought Pixies tickets from TicketMaster...god damn...$15 for just service charges!!
Plus I can't even go, cause I forgot it was the same night as Of Montreal...who, whoop the Pixies (lame for playing crappy venues who use ticketmaster) asses.  So now I need to see if I can find someone who has tickets for the thursday show and wants to trade for the friday show...or sell my ticket.  But yeah...the new Of Montreal album is pretty awesome.  Has some super great songs..."So Begins Our Alabee" = The coolest 80's slang word you can think of.  Other songs seem like a bit of filler, but are still cool.  All in all a great fun indie dance album...(I don't dance) but now I want to.

Oh!  Second highlight of the weekend...Chris's brother Anthony was in a school musical of the Music Man...the songs in that play suck...but Anthony is amazing!  Such comic character...hillarious...

Did a surf song for song fight this week...I love surf music.

...wow!!  Okay...lets start with this...

After some Boys Big Boy with Wes (not an innuendo) we headed over to spaceland for the J Mascis & the Fog concert.  They line wasn't very long, but crowded.  Someone mentioned they were handing out numbers for tickets and only about 100 would get in...We had #150 & #151...and the guy said it was doubtful we'd get in...but we stayed in line...what the hell.  Then I began to think...why would they hand out #'s if there was already a line...I flipped the flyer over to reveal a flyer...it was a fucking flyer...so guys was pretending to hand out number to buy tickets so people would take is stupid flyer!!  We got in without a problem.  Got my giant beer...and toiletpaper earplugs...

First band:
30sec songs loud and energetic...fun...nothing special.

Second Band:
Oooooh boy!!  Supreme Dicks...Wes and I are still confused.  Not only did they take over an hour to setup. But we still aren't sure if they were a novelty act or not.  They were so bad that they were good, then bad again, making them really good...in that funny, Jack Black is standing next to me way.  Lets just say a band with 4 guitar players, one of which we named Magic (dressed in Cheetah print pants and a furry coat, and looked like a woman)...a drummer who played with mallets, and some random guy in a wresting mask and one of those doggy cones around his neck (so he would stop biting his ass?) playing some sort of phototheremin.  After 2 "songs" they announced their slide guitar player has arrived...as they proceeded to play, he set up on stage, with a couple other guys just walking around with him...I can't describe in words this band.  Worse than Built To Spill live...songs were amazing thou...epic jam songs with epic vocals...I was thinking that they were retarded, making them pretty good.  But yeah...probably best worst band ever!!

Third Band:
Let me preface...I was planning on seeing J Mascis for a while...didn't think it important to preorder tickets...who really knows who J Mascis is...well...Ron Bentley tells me Dinosaur Jr. got back together, and that tonights show might be a secret Dino Jr. show...which it was...SO FUCKING AWESOME!!  Wes even thought it was amazing and he didn't know a single song!  J Mascis, Lou Barlow...and that other drummer guy...I can check them off the list of bands I'm pissed I never saw cause A:  They broke up before I was old info to go to clubs  B:  They/He Are/Is Dead  C:  They never existed

So to recap:
(not so) Secret Dinosaur Jr. Show
Jack Black
Giant Spaceland Beer
Magic w/the Cheetah Pants

...fill in what I forgot wes...

...yet brilliant...

The Ongoing Odyssey of Olladarius: Deep in the land of the time before, an ancient valley of fog and mist... A crushing blow was thrown by Ollardrius the iron fist... Fire consumed the evil The dead rise in the heat The bow of serpent string Brings men down from their feet Ollardarius...man of ancient lore be told Ollardarius...with a mighty will so bold Thrown in the pits of hell O wretched fate twas his Withstand a lash of burden No way out there is Ollardarius...with a vengeful creed he swore Ollardarius...abolish evil evermore Upon the serpent string Osiris sins glaze fire To torment the hearts of all A suffering mans desire Ollardarius...and the quest to find the bow Ollardarius...for failure he does not know He moves swift like a griffin Thru darkened watching caves Into a room of skulls Fated men in fated graves Ollardarius...thou he knew his fate did he Ollardarius...to fulfill his destiny A lurch of fire brazed him His feet forged into rock Emerging from the shadows A creature began to talk "Ollardarius...your twisted fate doth be not" "Ollardarius...in yonder grave you shall rott" Ollardarius stood brazen "Malignancy cannot bind me" He fist thrust into stone Shattered and he was free Ollardarius...his iron fist doth just rule Ollardarius...to smote those wicked and cruel "Dieing Begoteth the dead" Shrieked the creature in dire pain Tis not all fated fortune For in this land he must remain Ollardarius...thou his deed may be renowned Ollardarius...to the underworld he's bound Vanquished evil from the land Tragic loss of hero missed Triumphant days in ancient time Ollardarius with iron fist (song to come)

RBHID show friday was fun...lost my voice...so I had to key in different octaves...i sounded like a Pirate...yaaaar!!!

Right before the show, Wes & I drove to Guitar Center.  Picked up the first cheap bass guitar we could find...bought it right there.  Wes's first bass...fastest sale ever...

I have a new pet.  Huju the spider.  More to come later...
What a great day to be a zookeeper...

Wow...what a great great night of rock!!

RBHID was a blast...with Wes's Hulk-hands & Kazoo solos, and that guy doing the chewbacca noises...not a single person there got us (who didn't know us).  Brilliant!  Best part...the finnally...a Bentleys cover of punch drunk, with Will Bentley playing drums...on a lefty drumset mind you!  He is that awesome!  And Ron jumped up on stage to help us salvage the song...cause although we rock...only real bentleys can do it justice...alas...they don't play it anymore =(

Sound lady was a bitch...oh dear I miss Paul Ill!

PBA was totally fun...so much room on stage...i just kept dancing/stumbling around in circles...got a recording of the show...hope it came out well.  Go bootleggers go!  Cheeeeese Burger!

Kevin Ridel is a cool guy...we threw back a few PBR's backstage...(no show is complete without a stockpile of PBR)...his band was fun...they wore Chefs Hats...

oh...and totally scared 2 girls away...they were by our merch table so I thought they wanted to buy something, they probably thought I was hitting on them...i'm awesome.

for a side note...Hujojo, the spider monkey in Justins shoe...who nibbles on his toes, is rad.

God Bless America

Once upon a time, cowboy erik (with a "k") roamed these neck of the woods.  They were lonely woods, and he was a lonely cowboy.  Fitting this happened to be.  As he walked deeper and deeper into the wood...now named the Ghouly Woods [because]...so to continue...cowboy erik (with a 'k') decided to settle down with a nice cowgirl, and have some cowkids...untilll one day when he was uphoarded for the PIRATES OF MEJFED!!  So terrified to death was Cowboy Erik (with a 'k') that he named the monument after the noble Romulus Kalbinasse.  A royal page to the distant kingdom of Gedhillias.  A kingdom which was later viciously attacked by mean pirates...who didn't share.  Nor care to share.  As caring to share would show weakness on the part of the PIRATES OF MEJFED.  With a gigantic hoolahoop the day was saved with one mighty swoop as the pirates lay in waste, destroied by the valiant Cowboy Erik (with a 'k').  But the danger was not yet averted.  One grumbly giant came waltzing into the town...sat by the river. and drank.  and drank.  and drank.  untill all the water was consumed, leaving non for yonder corn to grow and flourish.  Pestilence flandered through the land like a festering malignancy.  There was only one hope.  The noble Cowboy Erik (with a 'k') swore to save the land.  And so he called to the Gods...Fibius, Mallarium, and Pondimus-Rex...let forth your water and fill this land and it's great valleys.  Only you can prevent forest fires.

I was almost gonna write this journal is a foreign language...whatever. The Pillows are such a great band. For those who do no know of them, the are a Japanese rock band. Can be found in the show FLCL (a absolute favorite of RBHID---maybe not Wes...he hasn't see it). But yeah...they sing in Japanese and broken english which sounds japanese, but there songs rock so hard, it doesn't matter what they are saying ("Blues Drive Monster"). Since when did I ever care about lyrics...Weezer's Green album is much better not listening to the lyrics. Download and listen to Happy Bivouac ...I'd say buy it, but the Japanese import is $40 Guided By Voices, was probably the best concert I've ever been to. 2 Hour Set. 1 Hour Encore. Lots of Alcohol...consumed by the band (not me unfortunately). To bad there will be no more GBV shows =( So basically...I wanted to start a new band...based on this great band name i had...Troy's Bucket... Turns out there is already a band with that name *(if I have to explain the reference you shouldn't be reading this)* Now I have no reason to start a new band... There is even a band/guy called Chocolate Eruption!! What the hell!!
Hacksaw Jim Duggan
Bakes Treats
In The Oven
He's Hacksaw
Jim Duggan

Rednecks...men (and wo-men) with parachute pants carved out of the american flag patterned cloth...military haircut (and/or mullet [and prefered])...hummer drivers

Do you fall into one of these 3 catagorys?  (If yes)...Well my friend...you are a redneck.

Okay...first a great idea...thought...trend.  Is it just me, or is it Hip to be Homeless?   Maybe just in hollywood.  Gabby Leroy of the Goose Turkey Gang wears this great t-shirt which says "GIVE ME ALL YOUR CHOCOLATE"  (see footnote 1)

Lastly...I've been working my ass off at work.  They let me cut sound effects for this pilot called "The Cell" (see footnote 3) that is going to play on showtime or something like that.  I get to wake up at 3am, and go in and cut effects before the editors come in...but yeah...So i got to make great effects like kids in a bounce house, a skull getting crushed by rocks [which happen to be thrown at the persons head] , oh...and a bullet getting gouged out of an eye socket with a knife (see footnote 8)

Holy Fucking God!  Thank You For INTERNET!!

...i'm so lame =(

Yey!!  Last day, night, obscenely grotesque hours at KBIG!!  To celebrate, I'm playing She's Like The Wind, and maybe some other treasures.  I just moved to Burbank, and not having internet is killing me!!  I'm such a geek, but I need it (even though I'm never at home).

The popbandALICE, CD release/justin's b-day show was so rocking (and SOLD OUT!!)...greatness.  Since Knitting Factory beer is too much, Gen and I went across the street to the liquor store, and she helped my sneak in a giant bottle of Sierra Nevada...yummy!  I just kept drinking and the thing seemed bottomless...the night definitely got weird///lipstick and licking...Justin wished he had a camera...hmmm...good PBA song title...haha Peanut Butter Alligator!!

I've done so much moving these past 2 weeks.  First...at work I had to move a whole buildings from one facility to another...threw out so much stuff...and took more stuff.  I have so much junk, some stuff to sell on eBay, and some stuff for my studio.  Then I also had to move all my stuff to my new place...blah...so much junk.

Yey!! Full House is on next!! Have Meeercy...

...Cantalope...

...is the new Friday the 13th

I guess it came a day early, but at least it broke up the dullness of a 7 day week.  So, it's 6:30am and I'm walking to my car to drive to work.  I open the door (keep in mind I'm extremely tired) first thing I see confuses me.  Why are all my papers from the side door pocket on my front seat...did the wind blow them?  Cause it was a bit draft in my car...oh wait...I can stick my arm thru my window.  Oh look...lots of broken glass!  Wow...what else...oh where is my radio?  Not in MY car...

I racist description of the culprit:
A white trash, mexican, black man.
(not Asians, cause they don't do crime)
But I hope he enjoys my $75 CD player, and my burnt CD collection...oh, and my change drawer.  Man,,,really made out like a bandit.  Glad breaking my window was worth it.  At least Alf and Fez Monkey were safe.

The rest of the day went like clockwork (broken clockwork)...driving around with no music, with a broken window, and all that fun stuff...

but...the ultra super shitty day was turned around when I decided to go to Ron Bentleys B-day party!  So much fun!  Always nice hanging out with Ron and his new laptop.  Ron's mom cooked a wonderful dinner, and everything was okay =)  Thanks Ron...And Happy Birthday!!

____on a different side of the world...I've been dumpster diving trying to collect foam...for my studio!  Yey!  I not only go to play "She's Like The Wind" tonight, but also "Caribbean Queen"!!!  Homo-rabia!!  Going to disneyland tomorrow with my sister...yey!!  Now I just need to find a place to live...

How often does the opportunity present itself...once, maybe twice in a lifetime!  Wow...only one person will care...that I played Lost In Emotion by Lisa Lisa & Cult Jam.  Wow...this has been a great hour...Right now is Don't Wanna Miss A Thing (Aerosmith)...earlier was Hey Ya (Outkast), Crazy In Love [no rap version] (Beyonce)...all topped off with Lisa Lisa!  Wow...Wow...Wow.

Harold & Kumar Go To White Castle is most awesome.  See it...I'm serious.

I also decided I want British children.  British children are the best!  So proper and accented.  One of the guys at work (who happens to be British) brought in his kids, and they were awesome!  The little boy about 6 or so tried to hustle me into taking a collection of spoons and forks he managed to collect through out the office...after telling him I'd have to sleep on it, he proceeded to put the utensils back in his bag, which was full of other stolen office supplies.  Most Righteous!  So cute...I need British children...so single British women...pick up your phone!!

I guess I won't talk around the kids and ruin their pure accent.  They will grow up thinking their father is a mute...but in fact, just protective...of their precious accents!  I already got a name.  Cotton Bobbins.  Cotton Bobbins Krane.  PERFECT!!  And if there are too,,,um...the other one can be Lisa Lisa.  Lisa Lisa Krane...DONE
